Not so sure of that, I mean what do we really know about the Kerbals. From observation we can conclude they are far advanced beyond us in the biosciences, they have perfected cloning together with accelerated growth and full memory/personality transfer. Since no mention is made of life support means and requirements, we could conclude that perpetually sustainable microecologies are trivial for them. Then there is the lack of information about their reproduction, perhaps they bud?
they lay eggs that are hatched only in the fire and heat of a rocket explosion
Their small population size is probably limited by the low biodiversity on their planet.

Well in a cloned society genetic mutations are likely to become more severe as clones are taken from the clones before... Maybe some now have gills... Maybe others breathe on space dust... Anyway, the point is that, no matter what, these Kerbals will survive... Let\'s start shooting them into space!
They have a launchpad and assembly building yet the rest of the planet appears deserted and wild! Petro-chemical refinement processes, metallurgy, etc. I don\'t care why there only ever seem to be 3!
